title: Eliminate a Variable
text: The y's are already opposites so they will be eliminated once we add up the two equations.\n$$3x-2y=1$$\n$$-x+2y=9$$
speech: The y's are already opposites so they will be eliminated once we add up the two equations.\n 3 x minus 2 y is equal to, 1 \n negative x, plus 2 y is equal to 9
pacedSpeech: The y's are already opposites so they will be eliminated once we add up the two equations.  3 x minus 2 y is equal to, 1
negative x, plus 2 y is equal to 9

title: Add the Equations to Eliminate One Variable
text: Add the x's, y's, and constants. $$y$$ will be eliminated and then solve for $$x$$.\n$$2x=10$$\n$$x=5$$
speech: Add the x's, y's, and constants.  y  will be eliminated and then solve for  x .\n 2 x is equal to 10 \n x, is equal to 5
pacedSpeech: Add the x's, y's, and constants.   y
will be eliminated and then solve for   x

title: Substitute Solution into Original Equations
text:
Substitute $$x=5$$ into the first equation, $$3x-2y=1$$. Then solve for $$y$$.
$$3x-2y=1$$
$$3	imes5-2y=1$$
$$15-2y=1$$
$$-2y=-14$$
$$y=7$$
speech:
Substitute  x is equal to 5  into the first equation,  3 x, minus 2 y is equal to 1 . Then solve for  y .
 3 x minus 2 y is equal to 1 
 3 times 5, minus 2 y is equal to, 1 
 15, minus 2 y is equal to, 1 
 negative 2 y is equal to, negative 14 
 y, is equal to 7

title: Solution as Ordered Pair
text: Solution to the system of equations is $$(5,7)$$.
